Don't use matrix transformations in drawSprite2dMode
I do that so that we can compile using opengl es2
This is probably much slower than the previous version, but I guess it doesn't matter since the method is not called so often. If the speed becomes an issue, we can use both version of the methods.

logentry.author: treaves
logentry.msg:
Added logic to factor in the image circle produced by an eyepiece, to more realistically simulate what a user would see. This also entails a new property in the ini file.
A user should set the maxCircleSize to their largest eyepiece image circle. Then individual eyepieces have their value set, and the display takes the scale into account. This is an optional setting, so users that do not want it will not have to use it.

logentry.msg:
Use #ifdef ENABLE_NLS instead of #if ENABLE_NLS.
I've also replaced "#cmakedefine ENABLE_NLS ${ENABLE_NLS}" with "#cmakedefine ENABLE_NLS", because ${ENABLE_NLS} is either ON of OFF now (not 1 or 0), so "#if ENABLE_NLS" will never be true!

logentry.author: amohari
logentry.msg:
Add no-c-format flag to all extracted strings.
This ugly workaround is needed because xgettext flags some Qt format strings (such as "%1AU") as c-format, too. Then, if the translator puts a space after the digit (which is perfectly valid for Qt format strings), "msgfmt -c" will complain that it is not a valid C format string.

Getting on with changes for 0.9.0. I started to update the file locations for the file re-organisation. landscapes are done, not - the rest will follow the implementation in Stellarium proper.

logentry.author: matthewg42
logentry.msg:
First stage of the data file location changes. Landscapes files now install to .../stellarium/landscapes/... in sub-directories (one per landscape). Landscapes may also be installed in the user's personal directory (~/.stellarium/landscapes/ on Linux).
landscapes.ini is no longer used. New landscape.ini files per landscape have been created, with the path to the textures removed.

logentry.author: gajdosik
logentry.msg: The telescope sends its position only seldom and with limited accuracy. Therefore stellarium cannot show the current telescope position. Instead a position of the past (for example 0.5 seconds ago) is interpolated and shown. This delay (microseconds) must be configured in the telescope url in config.ini.

logentry.author: matthewg42
logentry.msg:
Multiple small changes as identified by Andras Mohari:
(c) should be \copyright in the copyright message.
5.3.1 Setting Your Location: \" should be " in the config file excerpt.
5.3.2 Setting the Display Resolution: LyX-code should be used (instead of Quote) for the config file excerpt.
5.6 Other .fab files: The * in "Note that * in..." should be typeset using typewriter font so that it matches the *.fab text in the same paragraph.
A. Configuration File: All occurences of colour should be replaced with color in section names and IDs. (That's the spelling used in the config file.)
2.4 Running Stellarium: Windows: The Stellarium installer creates an item in the Start Menu under in Programs section. Select this to run Stellarium.
5.3 The Main Configuration File: Windows: The configuration file, config.ini, is in the config sub-directory of the main Stellarium directory. If you installed to the default location, this will be C:\Program Files\Stellarium\config.
* A. Configuration File: init_view_pos. should read:
initial viewing direction. This is a vector with x,y,z-coordinates. x being N-S (S +ve), y being E-W (E +ve), z being up-down (up +ve). Thus to look South at the horizon use 0,1,0. To look Northwest and up at 45 degrees, use -1,-1,1 and so on.
A. Configuration File: flag_milky_intensity (float): should be "milky_way_intensity".
